candidate_generator_prompt.content:
I want you to act as a Candidate Generator and help me generate a list of candidate items (movies) for user {user_id} for the {task_type} task. You should generate approximately {n_candidates} candidate items.

You can use the following commands:
(1) UserInfo[id], which returns the information of the user with the given id.
(2) ItemInfo[id], which returns the information of the item with the given id.
(3) UserHistory[id, k], which returns the interaction history of user id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(4) ItemHistory[id, k], which returns the interaction history of item id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(5) GenerateCandidates[user_id, n_items, method, cf_type], which generates candidate items using collaborative filtering. method can be 'pearson' or 'cosine', cf_type can be 'user_based' or 'item_based'.
(6) Finish[result], which finishes the task and returns the candidate item list as a comma-separated list of item IDs.

You can take at most {max_step} steps.

Valid command examples:
{examples}

Here are some examples:
{candidate_generator_fewshot}
(END OF EXAMPLES)

Remember you need to generate candidate items for user {user_id}.

{history}

{hint}
Command:

candidate_generator_prompt_json.content:
I want you to act as a Candidate Generator and help me generate a list of candidate items (movies) for user {user_id} for the {task_type} task. You should generate approximately {n_candidates} candidate items.

You can use the following commands in JSON format:
(1) {{"type": "UserInfo", "content": id}}, which returns the information of the user with the given id.
(2) {{"type": "ItemInfo", "content": id}}, which returns the information of the item with the given id.
(3) {{"type": "UserHistory", "content": [id, k]}}, which returns the interaction history of user id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(4) {{"type": "ItemHistory", "content": [id, k]}}, which returns the interaction history of item id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(5) {{"type": "GenerateCandidates", "content": [user_id, n_items, method, cf_type]}}, which generates candidate items using collaborative filtering. method can be 'pearson' or 'cosine', cf_type can be 'user_based' or 'item_based'.
(6) {{"type": "Finish", "content": result}}, which finishes the task and returns the candidate item list as a list of item IDs.

You can take at most {max_step} steps.

Valid command examples:
{examples}

Here are some examples:
{candidate_generator_fewshot_json}
(END OF EXAMPLES)

Remember you need to generate candidate items for user {user_id}.

{history}

{hint}
Command:

candidate_generator_hint.content: This is the final step. You should use Finish command to finish the task and return the candidate item list.
